text: Just listening to this track, you already know it must be extremely hard to beat the level. I'm always amazed by videos that show people playing through these rhythm games, the speed of their hands and their reaction time almost feel out of this world.
author: SupraDarky

text: One of my favorite songs to play in Pop'n, and just to listen to in general, is Ubertreffen. If you haven't, give it a listen!
author: Chugalg

text: While I am also always impressed by these kinds of people, I have to say: Is it really "reaction" time? I'd reckon it becomes mere muscle memory at some point. If they would still have to "react", it would be impossible to 100% some of the hardest tracks.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing

author: Satanael

text: I've actually been thinking about creating that sort of playlist for a while now, it's just a matter of going through my whole list and select the appropriate tracks...!
author: SupraDarky

text:
@SupraDarky That would be really cool! (It is a long list to go through... But at least it's all in one place!) When I used to have exams, I would listen to upbeat tracks and try to get them in my head for during the exams because they made me work faster... 

I also wonder what other categories there could be, maybe "emotional" for slower tracks which aren't relaxing as such. You probably have some good ideas, so I look forward to seeing anything you put together!
